titleStmt.title: George D. Prentice to James F. Robinson
CWG7710

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Military Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p: Gov Robinson, Dear Sir, Capt. O. L. Baldwin, I am informed, wishes an appointment as Major. All who know him bear testimony that he is a most brave and accomplished officer. He has had much and perilous experience, and he is one of the very finest writers in the army. For the good of the service I earnestly wish him success in his application.

Very Truly Yours,
Geo. D. Prentice.
